Issues.Title: Directive Validators Not Emitting StatusChanges
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When combining directive validators (via `NG_VALIDATORS`) with reactive forms, these change the `status` of the reactive form but do not emit a corresponding `statusChanges` unless paired with a user interaction.

The simplest example is an input field that is assigned the `required` validator directive and initialised with an empty string. In this case the initial `status` of the form control changes from `VALID` to `INVALID`, as expected, but no `statusChanges` event is emitted.

The same behaviour is also present, when setting the form value programatically outside of user interactions, e.g., in life-cycle methods such a `ngOnInit`.

When there is, however, a value change triggered by direct user interaction or indirect user interaction, e.g., pressing a button that programmatically sets the form value, the expected status is emitted as `statusChange`.

Note that whenever `statusChanges` are unexpectedly not emitted a corresponding `events` emission is also missing.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-query-aqv6yuzm-vfbygddo?file=package.json,src%2Fmain.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Exception: Form status changes from `VALID` to `INVALID` while emitting a `statusChanges` event.
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 19.2.10
Node: 20.19.1
Package Manager: npm 10.8.2
OS: linux x64

Angular: 19.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, router

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1902.10
@angular-devkit/core         19.2.10
@angular-devkit/schematics   19.2.10
@angular/build               19.2.10
@angular/cli                 19.2.10
@schematics/angular          19.2.10
rxjs                         7.8.2
typescript                   5.8.3
zone.js                      0.15.0
```

### Anything else?

In case this is expected behaviour, it should be mentioned in the documentation.

Issues.Title: refactor: add a new version of the logic node
Issues.Body:
Adds a new version of logic node that is created via builders. The builder / actual logic node split allows the final logic for a node to be lazily merged together.

My plan is to eventually swap this in for FieldLogicNode and have the schema methods (`validate`, `apply`, etc.) work with the builders. The FieldNode will then build its logic when it is first created.

This should be the other main piece aside from relative paths which is needed to make self-referential logic work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: add a new version of the logic node" (#61079)

Issues.Title: test(router): This commit removes ZoneJS from the router tests
Issues.Body:
There is nothing in the Router that requires ZoneJS and we do not need `fakeAsync` as a mock clock. We can instead use any mock clock implementation to speed up test execution.

This removes ZoneJS completely from the bundle of the Router tests. ZoneJS causes the stacks to be unreadable when combined with the massive rxjs stack in the router transition.

This uses the new autoTick feature of jasmine's mock clock, allowing tests to be written without needing to have any knowledge of whether a clock is installed. This is also advantageous for debugging because all we need to do to remove the mock clock from the test is to comment out the install line and tests will then run with the real clock. This would clean up the stack even further and make execution entirely native.

Blocked by https://github.com/jasmine/jasmine/pull/2057 and a new jasmine release
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(router): This commit removes ZoneJS from the router tests" (#61078)

Issues.Title: refactor(router): Remove unnecessary runOutsideAngular in view transiâ€¦
Issues.Body:
â€¦tion helper

This refactor removes the unnecessary `runOutsideAngular` call in the view transition helper. The resolved promise re-enters the zone in the transition, so that will trigger the Angular zone anyways. If it didn't do that, it risks activated the route outside the zone, which is a bigger risk. Regardless, this function is only run once per navigation, so even if it _did_ result in an extra promise/timeout inside the zone, this is not excessive. Using ZoneJS to trigger rendering is known to overreact to events. Using `OnPush` or zoneless is more effective at mitigating this issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(router): Remove unnecessary runOutsideAngular in view transiâ€¦" (#61068)

Issues.Title: test(router): Fix slow-running infinite loop test and remove unnecessâ€¦
Issues.Body:
â€¦ary duplicate tests

The inifinite loop test is a real infinite loop and runs until a stack overflow happens. In addition, all the promise and observable tests are just duplicates of the other redirects and don't test any additional logic. Instead, this change updates one test to return an observable and another to return a promise
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test(router): Fix slow-running infinite loop test and remove unnecessâ€¦" (#61076)

Issues.Title: angular router CanActivateFn always getting cached http response with back button
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

angular router CanActivateFn always getting cached http response with back button

even with server-side has no cache configuration header ( also with client side header )

this happens in situation like login and press back button

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
with back button after logged in, not logged in guard ( implementing using CanActivateFn ) always get http response showing not logged in

the user should manually reload( twice ) the routed page to make the page work properly
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 19.2.9
Node: 22.15.0
Package Manager: npm 10.9.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1902.9 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         19.2.9 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   19.2.9 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          19.2.9 (cli-only)
```

### Anything else?

_No response_

<summary>angular/angular (@​angular/animations)</summary>

### [`v20.0.0-next.9`](https://redirect.github.com/angular/angular/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#2000-next9-2025-04-30)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/angular/angular/compare/20.0.0-next.8...20.0.0-next.9)

#### Breaking Changes

##### core

-   the `TestBed.flushEffects()` was removed - use
    the `TestBed.tick()` instead.
-   `provideExperimentalCheckNoChangesForDebug` has several
    breaking changes:
    -   It is renamed to `provideCheckNoChangesConfig`
    -   The behavior applies to *all* checkNoChanges runs
    -   The `useNgZoneOnStable` option is removed. This wasn't found to be generally
        more useful than `interval`
-   afterRender was renamed to afterEveryRender.
-   This commit deprecates `ng-reflect-*` attributes and updates the runtime to stop producing them by default. Please refactor application and test code to avoid relying on `ng-reflect-*` attributes.

    To enable a more seamless upgrade to v20, we've added the `provideNgReflectAttributes()` function (can be imported from the `@angular/core` package), which enables the mode in which Angular would be producing those attribites (in dev mode only). You can add the `provideNgReflectAttributes()` function to the list of providers within the bootstrap call.

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): avoid empty polyfill option for new zoneless application
Issues.Body:
To reduce the size of the initial `angular.json` for applications, newly generated zoneless applications will no longer contain an explicit empty `polyfills` option. The option can still be added and is available for use if needed by an application but the empty array value will no longer be present when generating a zoneless application.
This has no effect for applications using Zone.js (default).

Issues.Title: `ng build` re-runs server multiple times when multiple routes use `RenderMode.Prerender` in `app.routes.server.ts`
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

When defining multiple routes with `RenderMode.Prerender` in `app.routes.server.ts`, such as:
```typescript
{
  path: 'shop/:product',
  renderMode: RenderMode.Prerender,
  async getPrerenderParams() {
    return [
      'ccd8-123f',
      'f3ad-e1u4',
      'cvae-5ase',
    ].map(product => ({ product }));
  },
  fallback: PrerenderFallback.Server,
},
{
  path: '**',
  renderMode: RenderMode.Prerender,
},
```
it appears that the server is started multiple times â€” once per route â€” during `ng build`. This leads to the following error if the `isMainModule` guard is removed from `server.ts`:
```text
Error: listen EADDRINUSE: address already in use :::4000
```
In my case, I must remove the `isMainModule` check to support deployment via iisnode on Azure, but doing so causes this build issue.

### Minimal Reproduction

Remove `isMainModule` check from` server.ts:
```typescript
...
const port = process.env['PORT'] || 4000;
app.listen(port, () => {
  console.log(`Node Express server listening on http://localhost:${port}`);
});
export const reqHandler = createNodeRequestHandler(app);
```

Have multiple routes with `renderMode: RenderMode.Prerender` on `app.routes.server.ts`.

### Exception or Error

```text
`Error: listen EADDRINUSE: address already in use :::4000`
```

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 19.2.8
Node: 18.19.0
Package Manager: npm 10.8.1
OS: win32 x64
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`ng build` re-runs server multiple times when multiple routes use `RenderMode.Prerender` in `app.routes.server.ts`" (#30202)

Issues.Title: Unit tests using esbuild + Vite fail when reloading using Sqlite wasm
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Current Angular (19.x), but not using Application Builder for Karma

### Description

Unit tests using esbuild + Vite fail when reloading using Sqlite wasm.

- App is configured to use esbuild + Vite for unit testing with Jasmine + Karma.
- App imports Sqlite one way in production, but in tests, it is loaded via wasm in order to test Sql code.
- Start the test run with `npm test`.
- It will build the app and run the tests successfully once.
  - You will see a log in the output that says: `wasm size: 739,512 bytes`.
- Open `sqlite-db.service.spec.ts` and save.
- This should rebuild the tests and you will see a failure:
  ```
  failed to asynchronously prepare wasm: CompileError: WebAssembly.instantiate(): section (code 1, "Type") extends past end of the module (length 9396207, remaining bytes 828774) @+8
  ```
  - You will see a log in the output that says `wasm size: 828,787 bytes`.
- The size of the actual file being read from disk matches the first logged size, and it does not change when you save.
- The actual file can be found at `dist/test-out/**/sql-wasm-debug.wasm`, and you can see its size does not change.  It always matches the original file size of 739,512 bytes.

What could be going on that would cause this wasm to load differently on initial load of the tests vs a rebuild after save?

### Minimal Reproduction

- `git clone https://github.com/ekrapfl/sqlite-esbuild.git`
- `cd sqlite-esbuild`
- Repro is in default/main branch, so shouldn't need to change branches.
- `npm ci`
- `npm test`
- It will build the app and run the tests with the following output:
```sh
Application bundle generation complete. [1.580 seconds]

Watch mode enabled. Watching for file changes...
29 04 2025 21:36:17.505:WARN [karma]: No captured browser, open http://localhost:9876/
29 04 2025 21:36:17.511:INFO [karma-server]: Karma v6.4.4 server started at http://localhost:9876/
29 04 2025 21:36:17.511:INFO [launcher]: Launching browsers ChromeHeadless with concurrency unlimited
29 04 2025 21:36:17.514:INFO [launcher]: Starting browser ChromeHeadless
```

I marked this as regression because it works in Angular v19.x if I use Webpack instead of Application Builder. Any help would be appreciated!

Issues.Title: Unit tests using esbuild + Vite will rebuild during initial test run when using a large dependency
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Unit tests using esbuild + Vite will rebuild during the initial test run when they use a large dependency.

- App is configured to use esbuild + Vite for unit testing with Jasmine + Karma.
- App imports and uses a large dependency in a test--specifically from `@arcgis/core`.
- Start the test run with `npm test`/`npx ng test`.
- It will build the app and begin running tests. In the terminal it will say `Changes detected. Rebuilding...` and interrupt the test run to rebuild the app and re-run the tests.
- Does not happen with `npm start`/`npx ng serve`.

### Minimal Reproduction

- `git clone https://github.com/ekrapfl/karma-esbuild.git`
- `cd karma-esbuild`
  - Repro is in default/`main` branch, so shouldn't need to change branches.
- `npm ci`
- `npm test`
- It will build the app and begin running tests. In the terminal it will say `Changes detected. Rebuilding...` and interrupt the test run to rebuild the app and re-run the tests.

Here is an example of the output. Note that you see the build and test output twice (for example, the listed chunks and the `TOTAL: 1 SUCCESS`):

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/build): use utility helper to get project root paths
Issues.Body: The `application`, `karma`, and `unit-test` builders now all use the same utility function to get the project root and project source root paths. This helps ensure consistent behavior and removes repeat code within each.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/build): use utility helper to get project root paths" (#30195)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): remove explicit index option from new applications
Issues.Body:
With the index option now defaulting to `<project_source_root>/index.html` for the `application` build system, the explicit value present in new applications is no longer required. This removal further reduces the size of the `angular.json` file for new projects.

Blocked on a release of components.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): remove explicit index option from new applications" (#30192)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): skip spec project reference for minimal ng new
Issues.Body:
When generating a new project with `ng new` and the `minimal` option, a Typescript project reference to a `tsconfig.spec.json` should not be present since that file is not created with a minimal project.

Closes #30181
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): skip spec project reference for minimal ng new" (#30190)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): perform testing module cleanup when using Vitest
Issues.Body:
Ensure proper cleanup of the Angular testing module when running tests with Vitest.

Closes: #30186

---

Blocked on https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/61017 being released on NPM
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/build): perform testing module cleanup when using Vitest" (#30188)

Issues.Title: bug(Angular Material Docs): Broken version selector in docs
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

18, I think.

### Description

The selector used to toggle the version of documentation is not working, so you cannot access documentation from previous versions of Angular Material from the current docs.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f773d420-becb-488a-9356-77dde8469cc8

If there is a better place to submit this issue, please let me know.

### Reproduction

This is a bug with Angular Material's website that hosts its documentation, not a component, so I cannot reproduce it via code.

### Expected Behavior

I expected the selector to expand a list of options to choose from

### Actual Behavior

The selector does not expand a list of options but occasionally flashes part of the menu.

### Environment

- Angular: 19.2.12
- CDK/Material: N/A
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Angular Material Docs): Broken version selector in docs" (#30995)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(All): Angular Material Figma Design Kit
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

Does the Angular Material team have their own Figma design kit? If so, could you publish it as a template for others?

Angular Material has quite a few differences from the Material Design System specifications, and it is a pain for a design team starting if they have to heavily modify the official Material Figma to match the Angular Material implementation. Other third-party Angular Material Figma kits are out there, but they are either extremely outdated or don't follow the Angular Material token system.

My company has a tiny design team and is considering using Telerik/Kendo for Angular because it has a Figma design kit, disregarding how bad the actual code implementation is with Kendo.

I'm sorry if this should be under discussions instead, but I don't appear to be able to create one.

### Affected documentation page

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(All): Angular Material Figma Design Kit" (#30994)

Issues.Title: bug(Stepper): .mat-step-icon-state-done has no default values for color and background-color
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hello!

As you can see from the dev console **color** and **background-color** has no default value.
The circle is in this case invisible.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed2db543-7e8a-451f-bcdf-6df86bb40662)

Thanks Team!

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

1.  Open dev console and inspect **.mat-step-icon-state-done**
2. See that color and bg is undefined.


### Expected Behavior

background-color and color should have a default value

### Actual Behavior

no default value

### Environment

- Angular: 19.2.11
- CDK/Material: 19.2.11
- Browser(s): Chrome, latest.
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Body:
Fixes that the `theme-color` schematic wasn't generating the `surface-container-low` token.

Fixes #30948.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/schematics): surface-container-low token not emitted" (#30985)

Issues.Title: feat(slide-toggle): add ability to change slide-toggle icons
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

We should be able to customize the slide-toggle on and off icons and not be forced to use the default minus and check icons. The icons can enhance the user experience by displaying an icon related to the toggle action. Also, there are cases where someone want to use internal icons instead of the material ones.

### Use Case

- A toggle for dark and light themes displaying sun and moon icons.
- Mute and unmute slide toggle.
- Disable or enable notifications.

Pretty much every use case can benefit from this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(slide-toggle): add ability to change slide-toggle icons" (#30982)

Issues.Title: bug(form-field): Extra space in Outline MatFormField Notch when label content is empty
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Extra space in Outline MatFormField Notch when the width of the label is 0. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/009a71fb-9d1d-4341-9c1f-460a850f025a)

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-starter-otgsx4ue?file=src%2Fmain.ts




### Expected Behavior

The extra space (padding-right: 8px) **SHOULD BE REMOVED** if the label content is empty, when
- floatLabel = always OR 
- floatLabel = auto AND there is value filled in to the form field.


The padding-right is being set by following css class: 
.mdc-notched-outline--notched .mdc-notched-outline__notch

### Actual Behavior

The extra space (padding-right: 8px) is **VISIBLE** despite the label content is empty, when
- floatLabel = always OR 
- floatLabel = auto AND there is value filled in to the form field.

Package Manager: yarn 4.4.1
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: [Cherry pick] fix(multiple): ensure mat-option parents are the offsetParent
Issues.Body:
**Note:** this is a cherry-pick of #30977.

We have several components where we use the `offsetTop` of the `mat-option` to determine how much to scroll, however this only works if the panel is the option's `offsetParent`. For that to happen we need a position different from `static`.

Fixes #30974.

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): Datepicker input shouldn't have aria-haspopup attribute
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The input of the datepicker has an unnecessary aria label.

According to the [mdn web docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-haspopup) an HTML element should only have the aria attribute aria-haspopup if this element can trigger the popup.

> The aria-haspopup attribute indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element that can be triggered by the element on which the attribute is set.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-starter-fbjgk3ht?file=src%2Fmain.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. simply use the datepicker as it is described in the docs
```
<mat-form-field>
  <mat-label>Choose a date</mat-label>
  <input matInput [matDatepicker]="picker">
  <mat-hint>MM/DD/YYYY</mat-hint>
  <mat-datepicker-toggle matIconSuffix [for]="picker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
  <mat-datepicker #picker></mat-datepicker>
</mat-form-field>
```
You will get a input with the aria-haspopup label.

```
<label matformfieldfloatinglabel="" 
       class="mdc-floating-label mat-mdc-floating-label" 
       id="mat-mdc-form-field-label-83"
       for="mat-input-64">
    <mat-label>Choose a date</mat-label></label>
    <input matinput=""
           class="mat-mdc-input-element mat-datepicker-input mat-mdc-form-field-input-control mdc-text-field__input cdk-text-field-autofill-monitored"
           aria-describedby="mat-mdc-hint-165"
           id="mat-input-64"
           aria-invalid="false"
           aria-required="false"
           aria-haspopup="dialog"
           data-mat-calendar="mat-datepicker-81">
<mat-datepicker></mat-datepicker>

```

### Expected Behavior

In this case the input element can't trigger the calendar popup so it shouldn't have the label `aria-haspopup="dialog"` attribute.

### Actual Behavior

The input element has the aria attribute `aria-haspopup="dialog"`

### Environment

- Angular: 19.2.6
- CDK/Material: 19.2.9/19.2.9
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): linux x64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(COMPONENT): Datepicker input shouldn't have aria-haspopup attribute" (#30973)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/schematics): support project index file discovery for object-form and default
Issues.Body: The project index file discovery process now supports finding paths for projects that use the object-form of the `index` field and also for projects that do not explicitly specify an index. Starting with v20, the index field will default to `<project_source_root>/index.html` if not present in the build options for the `application` build system.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/schematics): support project index file discovery for object-form and default" (#30967)

Issues.Title: [Patch port] fix(material/tabs): flicker when animationDuration is set to zero
Issues.Body:
**Note:** this is a patch port of #30966

The tabs have a fallback that sets `transition-delay: 1ms` in case users disabled animations without going through one of our APIs. That was also applying when they set `animationDuration="0"` which is a supported API. The result was a slight flicker.

These changes resolve the flicker by treating `animationDuration="0"` in the same way as if animations were disabled globally.

Fixes #30964.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[Patch port] fix(material/tabs): flicker when animationDuration is set to zero" (#30968)
